What happens if there is a disagreement.answer: To get Child Care Subsidy you need to submit a claim. You must be using an approved child care provider. If eligible, we'll pay the subsidy directly to your provider. If eligible, we may be able to backdate your subsidy for up to 28 days.

How do daycares deal with complaints?.answer: In a two parent family, both parents must meet the activity test and a family's Child Care Subsidy will be based on the parent with the lower number of hours.

Will Centrelink back pay child care subs.answer: To get Child Care Subsidy you need to submit a claim. You must be using an approved child care provider. If eligible, we'll pay the subsidy directly to your provider. If eligible, we may be able to backdate your subsidy for up to 28 days.
